--- title: 'Correlation' subtitle: 'Welcome to #30DayChartChallenge 2021 day 13' date: '2021-04-13' image: 'day13_correlation.png' image-alt: '' description: 'Networks' output: html_document execute: eval: false --- ### correlation day 13 ### Inspired by: TidyTuesday 2019/35 - Simpsons Guest Stars by Wikipedia - author: "Cedric Scherer" ### data for Stats for pub health program created by imperial college Load libraries ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(ggtext) library(patchwork) library(ggcorrplot) library(extrafont) theme_update(rect = element_rect(color = NA, fill = "#a9f51d"), line = element_blank(), text = element_text(color = "black")) ################# MANIPULATION ############################ data<- read.csv(file="cancer data for MOOC 1.csv", header = TRUE, sep = ',') sum(is.na(data)) data[is.na(data)]<-0 data$fruitveg<- data$fruit + data$veg names(data)<-c("patient_id","Age","Gender","BMI","Smoking","Exercise", "Fruit","Veg","Cancer","Fruit & Veg") corr_df<-data%>%select(-1) corr<-cor(corr_df) corr2<-cor(corr_df[c(-6,-7)]) ####################### PLOTTING ###################### correlation <- ggcorrplot(corr,method="circle")+ ggtitle(label="Cancer and contributing factors", subtitle="Causation is multifactorial, and provide examples of modification of the risk factors through prevention, \nunderstanding of population cancer aetiology interaction effects between risk factors and joint factors.\n'Evaluating intrinsic and non-intrinsic cancer risk factors' 2018\n(Wu, S., Zhu, W., Thompson, P. et al.)")+ theme(plot.title = element_text(family="Courier New",size=14,face="bold",color="#460046"), plot.subtitle = element_text(family="Courier New",size=11), axis.text = element_text(size=11,family="Courier New",face="bold"), legend.title = element_text(size=8,family="Courier New"), legend.text = element_text(size=8,family="Courier New")) #plot.margin = margin(5,5,5,5)) correlation2<-ggcorrplot(corr2,hc.order = TRUE, type = "lower", outline.col = "white",lab = TRUE)+ theme(legend.position = "none", axis.text = element_text(size=11,family="Courier New",face="bold")) main_plot <-correlation + correlation2 ################### WIGGETTING ############################ labels <- tibble( labels = c( "
Exercise
13%", "
Fruit & Veg
-25%", "
BMI
-12%", "
Gender
20%", "
Smoking
30%" ), x = 1:5, y = rep(1, 5) ) legend <- ggplot(labels, aes(x, y)) + geom_richtext(aes(label = labels), fill = NA, color = NA, vjust = 0) + annotate("text", x = 3.5, y = 1.018, label = "Correlated Risk factors", size = 15, fontface = "bold", family = "Courier New") + scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0.6, 6.1)) + scale_y_continuous(limits = c(1, 1.02)) + theme_void() + theme(plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#87cf80")) ########################### CAPTIONING ##################################### caption <- ggplot(data.frame(x = 1:2, y = 1:10)) + labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, caption = "Viz @fgazzelloni| Source: Imperial College data Mooc | Correlation Day 13")+ theme(line = element_blank(), plot.caption = element_text(size=8, family="Courier New",color="#460046",face="bold"), panel.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent"), plot.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent",color = "transparent"), panel.border = element_rect(color = "transparent"), axis.text = element_blank()) ###################### SAVING ############################ final <- legend + main_plot + caption + plot_layout(ncol = 1,heights = c(0.6, 1, 0)) ragg::agg_png(here::here("day13_correlation", "Correlation_day13.png"), res = 320, width = 14, height = 8, units = "in") final dev.off() ``` :::
